intro: Lindsaea quadrangularis subsp. subalata, commonly known as the slender-stemmed lindsaea, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, upright stems and elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with white to pale pink flowers, which are typically short-lived. It thrives in shaded, moist environments, often found in cloud forests and montane regions. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important component of its native habitat.
